content.question: The graph of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Which of the following expressions equals 2 ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3 from the left, of, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3 from the right, of, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3 from the left, of, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
